snippet: Representative John A. Boehner of Ohio was re-elected speaker of the House amid open dissent from conservatives that suggested the last Congress’s turmoil would live on.
abstract: Rep John A Boehner is narrowly re-elected speaker of the House amid open dissent from conservatives that suggest last Congress's turmoil will live on; indicates, in his opening address, that Republican majority would make federal debt and deficit its singular focus and delivers blunt message to those he sees as more interested in stirring dissension than in being constructive.
lead_paragraph: Representative John A. Boehner of Ohio was re-elected speaker of the House amid open dissent from conservatives that suggested the last Congress’s turmoil would live on.

headline.seo: Boehner Narrowly Holds On to Speaker’s Post
headline.main: Boehner Retains Speaker’s Post, but Dissidents Nip at His Heels
headline.print_headline: Boehner Retains Speaker’s Post, But Dissidents Nip at His Heels
